How to Get Fresh Food from a Fast Food Restaurant Bridget Ilene Delaney , Yahoo! Contributor Network Sep 18, 2007 "Share your voice on Yahoo! websites. Start Here ." More: Fresh Foods Fast Food Restaurants Flag Close All people like fresh food. Most people can agree that fast food restaurants are conveniet. Yet, at times, it seems impossible to get fresh food from a fast food restaurant. This is not true. Fresh food from a fast food restaurant is not a myth. It can be obtained. In order to get fresh food from a fast food restaurant, diners must arrive there at a certain time. Diners may think that arriving around the mealtime hour is a good solution to getting fresh food. It seems to make perfect sense.
Arrive at lunch time and lunch should be fresh. Arrive at dinner time and dinner should be fresh.
This is not the case.
When it comes to the fast food business, restaurants start preparing food for the meal time rush about an hour ahead of time. For lunch, that's around 11am and for dinner, that's around 4pm. Sometimes workers will start preparing the food a bit later or a bit earlier.
If diners are simply driving through to pick up food, arrive with enough time to place an order. Do not expect to definitely get fresh food, though. Even if diners arrive at 11am or 4pm, there's the factor of what the workers had to do for the day. Other tasks may have prevented them from cooking the food at a certain time.
It is definitely more likely for diners who are driving through to pick up fast food to get fresh food if they arrive an hour before the meal time rush.
Dine-in diners are more likely to be able to get fresh food. Of course, this will depend on the amount of customers that are in line at the restaurant and in line at the drive-through.
Dine-in diners can stand back at the menu acting as if they are deciding what to order if they know what they want or actually discussing orders. While doing this, they can watch what is happening in the back. Diners can then see when new food is starting to be cooked and time when they want to join the line in order to buy fresh food.
The elusive quest to get fresh food from a fast food restaurant can be put to an end.
